quiz.title: Unit 2: 1D Kinematics (Quiz 1)
quiz.subtitle: Kinematics Problems - Speed, Displacement, and Acceleration (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question:
The speeds of a car are recorded as follows:
Point A to Point B = 30 m/s
Point B to Point C = 40 m/s
Point C to Point D = 20 m/s

What is the average speed of the car?
questions.explanation: Average speed = (30 + 40 + 20)/3 = 90/3 = 30 m/s. This assumes equal time intervals or equal segments between points.

questions.question: What is the total distance of a van that travels 90 m due North and 90 m due South?
questions.explanation: Distance is a scalar quantity (total path length). The van travels 90 m north plus 90 m south = 180 m total distance.

questions.question: What is the total displacement of a van that travels 50 m due North and 40 m due East?
On a displacement-time graph, which of the following might indicate acceleration?
questions.explanation: Slope of displacement-time graph = velocity. Changing slope means changing velocity, which is acceleration.

questions.question: Given that a displacement-time graph has the following coordinates: (2 s, 10 m) and (5 s, 25 m), what is its average speed?
questions.explanation: Average speed = (25 m - 10 m) / (5 s - 2 s) = 15 m / 3 s = 5 m/s.

questions.question: How fast will an object (in motion along the x-axis) be moving at t = 20 s if it had a speed of 4 m/s at t = 0 and a constant acceleration of 3 m/s²?

A car is rolling toward a cliff with an initial speed of 25 m/s. The maximum negative acceleration that the brakes can provide is -0.5 m/s². If the cliff is 400 m from the initial position of the car, will the car go over the cliff?
options: It depends on the car's mass
questions.explanation: Stopping distance = $u^2/(2a) = (25)^2/(2×0.5) = 625/1 = 625$ m. Since 625 m > 400 m, the car cannot stop in time and will go over the cliff.

questions.question: A particle passes through point P with speed 12 m/s, moving along a straight horizontal path with constant acceleration 3 m/s². The particle passes through point Q, where PQ = 60 m. Find the speed of the particle as it passes through Q.

A particle passes through point P with speed 15 m/s, moving along a straight horizontal path with constant acceleration 4 m/s². The particle passes through point Q with velocity 50 m/s, 8 s after passing through P. Find the distance PQ.
A cyclist starting from rest reaches a position of 60 m in 4 seconds. If they did so with uniform acceleration, what was the acceleration?
